column4: Is there a bootloader that does OS probing at every boot? GRUB probes and saves all found OSs upon calling update-grub (writes into /boot/grub/grub.cfg), so if I install onto an usb drive and boot it from another computer, device nodes will be different and boot will fail :V
I guess to boot the usb from another system you would just have to be sure that the bios boot sequence was to boot usb first
I guess the device nodes you must mean like /dev/sdXX?   that should be handled by UUID
Certainly, but surely bioses don't reorder the booted drive to /dev/sda?
Yes, except for set root='(hd0,1)'
you must boot from old grub not grub2?
Not at all, I'm free to try whatever
in grub to root can be set to a UUID
or I should say in grub2 it can be
So the set root line and the search line replace eachother? Sec, pastebinning
http://pastie.org/4148721 -- ignore boot parameters
Does the search function override set root? If so, it will probably do fine
as seen here db601797-752f-446f-b7f8-0480ed0d7413  must be the UUID
Yes, I'm concerned about (hd0,1)
makes sense if it's overridden
I'm not sure maybe it looks there first and if fails to find it then it searches

All right, so let's say GRUB2 can boot the usb drive by UUID regardless of standard device node. It's still not possible to have it probe and list other installed operating systems, right? Such as if the boot flag for the Windows partition has been removed
(obviously I could boot into a full linux environment and fix that, but still)
no it will only boot what was known when the usb was booted as root and update-grub run
unless they happen to be the same on this other system but not lickly
right. Know of any alternative boot loaders with this functionality, by any chance?
maybe plop
